comments:
There are two problems.
1) Refreshing the C/C++ project with 5500 files hangs the Eclipse application (3
hours and more, but still didn't complete the refreshing of the project) and
slows down the Linux box ( Fedora 2,  Kerneal 2.6.8_1 , Pentium 4 2.2 Ghz with 
512 MB Ram and 1GB Swap ).

2) Binary search process (a background process ) that starts upon opening the
C/C++ project goes on and on forever sucking the CPU resource. Thus slowing
download the OS.

And sometimes it after very long time displays Out of Memory Error and sometimes
 it just hangs doing nothing but hogging the CPU.

"---------------start of error log----------------------
     !ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 Sep 20, 2004 14:03:21.516
!MESSAGE Error
!STACK 0

Version details:
Eclipse  3.1
Build Id=N200408300010
Java.version=1.4.2_05
Java.vendor=Sun Microsystems In
CDT 2.0.0

Please resolve this issue.
It is very frustrating to developer using CDT plugin as it slows down whole OS
and Eclipse UI too becomes very very slow.

Thanks inadvance
Manjunathan Padua Y
This is most likely a duplicate of Bug#149428.

(In reply to comment #1)
> This is most likely a duplicate of Bug#149428.

Agreed
Changing to target milestone to 4.0. This bug was fixed after 3.1.0. It may have been fixed in the 3.1 stream, but then it would be fixed in 4.0 too, hopefully...
